intro: Cryptolepis ruspolii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white, nocturnal flowers that emit a sweet fragrance, attracting moths for pollination. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Cryptolepis ruspolii is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
